description: Answer 8 weekly multiple-choice quizzes covering lecture and lab content. Quizzes 1-7 (2% each), Quiz 8 (6%). Conducted during lab classes with feedback provided afterward.
Individual report analyzing geological relationships of outcrops and their connection to the Sydney Basin's evolution. Requires figures, tables, and scientific references (1500-3000 words).
Practical exam identifying minerals and rocks in hand-specimen or thin-section during a 2-hour lab session. Uses fill-in answer sheets for specimen naming.
2-hour 10-minute comprehensive exam with MCQ, short-answer, and problem-solving questions covering lectures, labs, and fieldwork. Hurdle requirement: 50% minimum to pass the course.
